revision.text:
{{Use South African English|date=February 2014}} [[File:Denel Dynamics Skua.jpg|thumb|320px|Denel Dynamics Skua]] The '''Denel Dynamics Skua''' is a [[turbojet]]-engined [[target drone]] used to simulate fast-moving attack aircraft during surface-to-air and air-to-air training exercises and weapons tests. It is manufactured by the [[Denel Dynamics]] division of the [[South Africa]]n [[state-owned enterprise|state-owned]] [[Denel]] aerospace and defence conglomerate.
== Airframe == The Skua has a composite airframe, its wingspan is 3,57 m and length 6,00 m. Under-wing [[hardpoint]]s can carry tow-targets and signature enhancement equipment up to 160 kg. An internal payload bay has a capacity of 70 kg. It is recovered by parachute and lands in an inverted position on airbags, this makes water landings possible.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=https://www.uvsr.org/docs/Denel_SA_Skua_200809.pdf |title=SKUA High-Speed Target Drone |publisher=[[Denel Dynamics]] |year=2008 |accessdate=2014-02-17}}</ref>
===Performance=== * Maximum speed: Mach 0,86 at 10 000 m * Controllable range: 200 km (line of sight) * Altitude: from 10 m to 10 700 m * Endurance: 85 minutes at 10 000 m and Mach 0,75 <ref name="autogenerated1"/>
== System == The system includes between four and eight UAVs, a launcher vehicle, a mobile [[ground control station]] (GCS) and various support equipment.
The truck-mounted [[zero-length launcher]] includes an engine starter. The mobile GCS houses the flight control system and telemetry equipment used to control the aircraft. The GCS can control two drones in flight at the same time. Tracking the drones is by feedback from the on-board navigation system.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=9223:denel-dynamics-keeping-skua-going&catid=35:Aerospace&Itemid=107 |title=Denel Dynamics keeping Skua going |first=Leon |last=Engelbrecht |publisher=DefenceWeb |date=2010-08-10 |accessdate=2014-02-17}}</ref>
==Uses== * The Skua has been used during development of the [[A-Darter]] SRAAM.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&id=24166 |title=A-Darter January flight tests successful |publisher=DefenceWeb |date=2012-03-07 |accessdate=2014-02-17}}</ref> * Testing of the Brazilian [[MAA-1 Piranha]] air-to-air missile.<ref>{{cite web|last=Campbell |first=Keith |url=http://www.engineeringnews.co.za/article/denel-breaks-into-brazilian-market-2005-05-13 |title=Denel breaks into Brazilian market |date=13 May 2005 |publisher=Engineering News |accessdate=18 October 2012}}</ref> * Testing of the [[Umkhonto (missile)|Umkhonto]] surface-to-air missile by Denel Dynamics and for operational missile training by the [[South African Navy]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.janes.com/article/28033/land-based-umkhonto-fired-for-the-first-time |first=Helmoed-Römer |last=Heitman |title=Land-based Umkhonto fired for the first time - IHS Jane's 360 |publisher=Janes.com |date=2013-10-07 |accessdate=2014-02-17}}</ref>
